snippet: To the management of Cowboys Stadium, the home of the Cotton Bowl, the announcement of a college playoff meant an enticing opportunity to host it.
abstract: Cotton Bowl, relegated to second-class status during the Bowl Championship Series era, experienced an instant renaissance when university presidents ushered in a four-team playoff system for the 2014 postseason; backed by the Dallas Cowboys’ owner Jerry Jones, and the cachet of Cowboys Stadium as its calling card, the Cotton Bowl has become a major player as bids are considered and sites determined.
lead_paragraph: To the management of Cowboys Stadium, the home of the Cotton Bowl, the announcement of a college playoff meant an enticing opportunity to host it.

headline.seo: Cowboys Stadium Hopes to Expand College Football Lineup
headline.main: Cotton Bowl Reinvigorated by Chance to Host a Final
headline.print_headline: Cotton Bowl Reinvigorated by Chance to Host a Final
